poem:
Title: The Betrayer's Sorrow

With aid carried in arms as a martyr's crown,
In Gaza's corner, stark grief etches an epitaph.
Oh, France, your call echoes the tacit, yet loud,
Injustice rampant, where innocence wears a shroud.

Macron, himself a lamenting mourner towers,
Over the lost faces of Palestine's righteous flowers.
Pity on the death-merchant's remorseless eyes, 
In their myopia, humanity's demise.
